column4: that "help" entry on the ubuntu feisty starter guide for firestarter is bogus
most of the firestarter stuff if a bit on the thin side
do you have a good reason to use a firewall in ubuntu or are you just comming from windows ?
don'T worry about the firewall then, it's not a neccesity in linux,  not like it is in windows
man iptables  it is the cli userspace for netfilter wich is the actual firewall,  firestarter is jsut a gui frontend
don'T give out your user password and don'T run as root and you'll be fine
is this a home computer or a business one ?
home
personnaly I don'T worry about it ,
I'm a home user with one comp, directly connected to a dsl modem no router, and I don'T use the firewall , and I don'T worry,  I worried in windows quite a bit
unlikely
terminal ,  sudo rm  /path/filename
doesn't rm delete it?
I thought you wanted to get rid of the file,  sorry then,  just permission ?   sudo chmod 755 /path/filename
the lock remains  and now it seems I've added an X to the scenario
very odd,   are you using your admin username and passw ?
not what I mean ,  how many accounts do you have ?
gimme the full path and name of this file please
one as far as I can tell
ok try this   sudo chown username:username /path/filename && sudo chmod 775 /path/filename
replace username with your username
